content: As a language model, I don't have access to current statistics on the competitiveness of research opportunities at Northwestern University. However, it's important to note that research opportunities can vary in their level of competitiveness, depending on factors such as the department, the faculty member, and the specific project or program. That being said, it's generally a good idea to prepare in advance and demonstrate your qualifications and interest in the research you're interested in. This might include maintaining high grades, conducting independent research, completing relevant coursework, gaining valuable experience through internships, and developing specific research skills. It's also important to keep in mind that while some research opportunities may be more competitive than others, there are typically many opportunities available to students of all levels and backgrounds. Don't be discouraged if you don't immediately find the perfect research opportunity - keep exploring and pursuing your interests, and you'll likely find a research opportunity that aligns with your goals and aspirations.
